author: Special Correspondent
text:
The contribution to the Chief Minister’s Public Relief Fund for rehabilitation of the flood-affected people in the State has gone up to Rs 303.90 crore.

On Monday, a total of Rs 17.10 crore was given for the relief fund, according to an official release. ICICI Bank senior general manager and business head, South India, Amit Palta, presented a cheque for Rs 10 crore on behalf of the bank to Chief Minister Jayalalithaa at the Secretariat.

Ashok Leyland Limited managing director Vinod Dasari presented a cheque for Rs 3 crore. The Amalgamations Group chairman A. Krishnamoorthy gave Rs 2 crore; South Indian Film Artistes’ Association president M. Nasser gave a cheque for Rs 1.10 crore and Ford Motor Private Limited director R. Srikanth gave a cheque for Rs 1 crore, the release said.
title: Contributions to flood relief crosses Rs.300 cr.
